alternative_parents.description: Compounds derived from an alkene by replacing a hydrogen atom with a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Bromoalkenes

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a bromine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organobromides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds in which the halogen atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom of a carbon-carbon double bond (C=C).
class.name: Vinyl halides

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as vinyl bromides. These are vinyl halides in which a bromine atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom.

direct_parent.description: Vinyl halides in which a bromine atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom.
direct_parent.name: Vinyl bromides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Vinyl halides in which a bromine atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom.
subclass.name: Vinyl bromides

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and a halogen atom (At, F, Cl, Br, I).
superclass.name: Organohalogen compounds
